glsa.title: Pound: HTTP request smuggling
glsa.synopsis: Pound is vulnerable to HTTP request smuggling, which could be exploited to bypass security restrictions or poison web caches.

background.p: Pound is a reverse proxy, load balancer and HTTPS front-end. It allows to distribute the load on several web servers and offers a SSL wrapper for web servers that do not support SSL directly.

description.p: Pound fails to handle HTTP requests with conflicting "Content-Length" and "Transfer-Encoding" headers correctly.

impact.p: An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending HTTP requests with specially crafted "Content-Length" and "Transfer-Encoding" headers to bypass certain security restrictions or to poison the web proxy cache.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
